intro: Peucedanum whytei, commonly known as the Himalayan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at elevations between 2,000 and 4,000 meters. Its botanical features include a taproot system and a flowering period that occurs in late spring to early summer. Peucedanum whytei is often found in meadows and open slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
